content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code for the function `clean_column`:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    s = replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[- ]", "_")
end
```
This function takes a string `col` as input, firstly it converts all characters to lower case using the `lowercase()` function. Then, any leading or trailing whitespaces are removed with `strip()`. The spaces and hyphens are replaced by underscores using the `replace()` function where we replace "[- ]" (spaces and hyphens) with "_".
